name: Musculocutaneous nerve — major motor targets
text: Musculocutaneous nerve (lateral cord). Major muscles innervated: coracobrachialis, biceps brachii, brachialis. Clinical: elbow flexion and forearm supination weakness with injury.

name: Axillary nerve — major motor targets
text: Axillary nerve (posterior cord). Major muscles innervated: deltoid and teres minor. Clinical: deltoid weakness and decreased shoulder abduction with injury.

name: Radial nerve — major motor targets
text: Radial nerve (posterior cord). Major muscles innervated: triceps brachii, brachioradialis, extensor carpi radialis longus (ECRL), extensor carpi radialis brevis (ECRB). Clinical: wrist/finger extension deficits with injury (wrist drop).

name: Posterior interosseous nerve — major motor targets
text: Posterior interosseous nerve (branch of radial nerve). Major muscles innervated: supinator, extensor carpi ulnaris (ECU), extensor digitorum (EDC), extensor digiti minimi (EDM), abductor pollicis longus (APL), extensor pollicis longus (EPL), extensor pollicis brevis (EPB), extensor indicis proprius (EIP). Clinical: finger/thumb extension weakness with preserved wrist extension depending on lesion level.

name: Median nerve — major motor targets
text: Median nerve (medial and lateral cords). Major muscles innervated: pronator teres, flexor carpi radialis, palmaris longus, flexor digitorum superficialis; thenar: abductor pollicis brevis, opponens pollicis, superficial head of flexor pollicis brevis; lumbricals: first and second. Clinical: loss of thumb opposition and sensory loss in radial 3½ digits with distal lesions.

name: Anterior interosseous nerve — major motor targets
text: Anterior interosseous nerve (branch of median nerve). Major muscles innervated: flexor digitorum profundus to index and middle (first and second), flexor pollicis longus, pronator quadratus. Clinical: inability to make 'OK' sign (pinch weakness) in AIN palsy.

name: Ulnar nerve — major motor targets
text: Ulnar nerve (medial cord). Major muscles innervated: flexor carpi ulnaris (FCU), flexor digitorum profundus to ring and small (third and fourth), intrinsic hand: palmaris brevis, abductor digiti minimi, opponens digiti minimi, flexor digiti minimi, lumbricals 3 and 4, interossei, adductor pollicis, deep head of flexor pollicis brevis. Clinical: ulnar claw and loss of finger ab/adduction with injury.
